Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good reception staff, slightly pricey”
Reviews.Author: le1ther
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two day vist to Amsterdam where I stayed here. The hotel it's self is simple yet elegant in its design as you can see from the photos, because it's simple designs you can see the rooms are clean as there is none of the odd corners of the room that are not accessible to clean like some older hotels Like other comments the bathroom could be an issue if there are two of you but as I was travelling alone I quite liked it. You get free wifi and there is a uk standard socket, while I had an issue with mine the hotel were good enough to lend me an eu adaptor. The distance on the map makes te hotel look far out but actually it's 2 stops on the metro which takes 10 minutes. I'd buy a day (or longer) travel pass, it's a great way to get around. I got a taxi from the central station a couple of times after the metro had finished and it was 12 euros both times. Would I go back, yeah it was good but really I don't like paying more that 100 euro a night if it's for room only (breakfast is 18 euros extra). I should also note the rates don't cover tourist tax which was seven euro a night. Good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean”
Reviews.Author: SilverFang13
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arena +Friendly and helpful staff with very good english. +Breakfast. +Big, nice and clean room. +Computers with internet that can be borrowed in the lobby. -Bad location, only walking distance to the zoo. -Thin walls/doors. +/- 200m to the tram that goes to Leidseplein, where the Holland Casino and all the pubs, shopping etc are, takes only 5min by tram. 400m to the metro, that takes you to the shopping area around central station, only 2 stops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation not far from the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: linazanou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice area of Amsterdam, not far from the centre. It's near the 9 and 14 tram lines and the subway Weeserplein that take you easily into the centre and the major sights. . . The hotel was very trendy and stylish. The rooms are clean and very unique, there's a small living room on the bottom floor and the bed is placed on top, (at least both rooms 40 and 42 were like this). There's a nice nightclub that is part of the hotel and it is located near the entrance, apparently it is very cool and loads of Dutch people go to it at the weekend. You can also rent bicycles from the hotel, they cost 15 Euros per day, but you should book them from the previous day as they run out of them very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and original accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Eden B
Reviews.Content: I count my 6-night stay at Hotel Arena as one of my holiday's successes: Not only were the accommodations clean and comfortable, but the staff members conducted themselves with poise and professionalism! While the hotel's location is a good walk outside center (don't try strolling from Centraal Train Station), it's located close to the 9 and 14 tram lines, which take you virtually anywhere you'd want to go. Having read all the property's reviews on this site, I'd been expecting more hassle--luckily, all went off without a hitch. A couple weeks before my arrival, I emailed the staff to request a quiet room away from the night club, and they were more than happy to oblige. Also, I didn't experience any billing issues or misunderstandings. I did have wifi devices with me, but the computer near the service desk became a convenient alternative when I needed to send longer messages and change my itinerary. It was open all times I needed to use it. While Room 241 was perfect for me, I don't think it would work as easily with two travelers. The bathroom features a clear glass wall with no shade, meaning it has no privacy from the main suite. Also, quarters were a bit cramped between the bed and tv. (I'd say there was maybe a foot of clearance.) For two, there definitely wouldn't be much space to lounge. - My pictures are of room 241, which doesn't feature a loft layout (this worked fine for me) - Noise wasn't a problem, though from time to time I could hear people's doors open and shut and conversation from the hallway - I'd never seen this: The room key, located in a slot next to the door, was needed to turn on and off any lights in the room - Since the restaurant/cafe menu looked fairly pricey (everything seemed around 15 euros or more), I ended up eating when I was out seeing the city or buying a la carte at Marqt in Rembrandtplein (credit or debit cards only). The closest I ended up eating to the hotel was at Golden Temple in Rembrandtplein, which offered terrific vegetarian dishes. - There's a water-canal taxi stop across from the hotel, however, I didn't look into how often it stopped at this location - I didn't experience any issues with water spilling over from the shower - The front desk let me know the hotel shuttle service--going between multiple hotels--is very unreliable. I opted to take a train between the airport and Centraal Station and a tram to and from the hotel. You can pay for the tram when you board, however, you must buy train tickets at a portal before boarding. (Altogether it's less than 8 euros.) Also, you can buy tram passes from Hotel Arena's front desk. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel, especially for solo travelers. As far away as it may be from Dam Square (2.5 km to be exact), it's a perfect place to settle in at the end of a day exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yik C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, beautiful decor, great service. The only tiny little thing from a 5 star is that the shower water pressure wasnt strong enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cool And Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: tripperhov
Reviews.Content: This was the first stay. Three stops on the metro from the main train station and a quick tram ride and we were at the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and gave us a welcome drink voucher. This is an old building converted into a hotel, so it was an interesting walk from reception to the rooms. Rooms are a good size, the design is modern and contemporary, especially the bathroom! The bed was a bit soft but comfortable. There was slight noise from the bathroom of the room next door. Room was equipped with a very modern TV (which had BBC1), tea/coffee facilities and an electronic safe. Internet was free. We redeemed the welcome drink voucher for a Â½ price beer at the hotel bar. We booked breakfast in advance and saved on the full price, breakfast was a good Dutch continental offering, including hot options. While reception confirmed the restaurant was open until 10pm, we could not get into the restaurant, so we ordered room service. Choice was good and the food was good, at usual room service prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arena”
Reviews.Author: Christine D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A large modern hotel with very friendly efficient staff. Breakfast was excellent, especially the choice of fresh bread which was delicious. However this came at a price and would have been better if bed and breakfast was an inclusive package. I did not find the bathroom design particulary pleasant as although it was very clean, modern and well stocked I really did not wish to face my husband whilst he was sat on the loo. The design was such that as I was lying on the bed reading, he was using the bathroom facilities which were directly opposite and had become completely see through once lit up. All I can say is we have been married for a long time but for a newly together couple this would have been an embarrasment!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Lola418
Reviews.Content: I would love to give this hotel 5 stars as the interior is definitely 'wow' for the most part and most of the staff were great, particular thanks to the Greek barman who definitely made our stay more enjoyable! We ended up staying longer than we had planned due to ill health, and the staff were thoughtful, checking we were ok in our room a couple of times a day. However there were many little things which took away from these positives. - shower(which is 'open', not in a cubicle) drain blocked, whole bathroom flooded on using it and all our towels were sodden just trying to make the floor ok to walk on - they could not mop up all the water however. Mentioned to reception but as far as we know it was not checked(certainly not fixed) so we used the bath for the rest of the stay. Admittedly the bath is probably the best I have ever been in but not sure that cancels out the inconvenience with the shower! - daily room cleaning is quite horrendous. On first look it seemed like all they had done was made the bed.. then we noticed they had taken the rubbish bag out of the bin and left out on the sofa, left used cups dirty in room and bathroom, crisp packet left out, toilet roll which we had out to use for tissues not replaced. - the studio room we had was not as special as I would expect from a boutique hotel(but lovely big bed) and TV sound and colour not great - internet on TV was horrible to use, take your laptop or use computers at reception! Due to aforementioned ill health we watched a few movies - individually these were ridiculously expensive but there is an option to watch as many as you like in 24 hrs for 15 euro. - Asked for a banana to go with lunch but was told that was not possible as the fruit had been taken downstairs after breakfast. We did later notice there was a supply of apples at reception, but still.. - Very noisy corridor when people walked up and down it when we were in the room. No way you could sleep through people going for breakfast or nearby rooms being cleaned! The food is good, to get value for money you need to eat a lot for breakfast though. It is very easy to get to and from the centre. The bar is a lovely place to spend time in. Most of the staff could not have been more helpful. We would return, but would also consider somewhere else if it was recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, dark and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fiona14a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the arena and would not return, we booked on the basis of 4 stars. The hotel is dark and not very clean, the room was freezing, especially the bathroom - which was also dirty. No dressing table mirror and a hair dryer that blew a puff of heat at you, whilst making your finger go into a cramp as you had to push button down whilst using it ! Wifi advertised in rooms, but not in 220 or this section of hotel which we found out when we asked. We requested a room change and were told to pack up, leave bags at reception and check back at 3 to see if a room was available... We didn't bother, as they couldn't guarantee it would be. Some staff very friendly others rude and slightly arrogant. Nice lunch in bar, breakfast fine. The hotel is two tram rides away from centre and a 20 euro taxi fare. Love Amsterdam but not the arena.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gekko76
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Amsterdam. Its not located right smack int he middle of Amsterdam, but its easy to access the city center on foot or by tram. Takes roughly 10-15 minutes to walk to what is defined as the city center. The design of the hotel is great, although the bathroom is a bit spacy! - Not alot of privacy, as the walls are made of glas. We had a room in two levels, which is great if you are a couple travelling, but I dought that it is a clever soution for someone travelling with children. We didnt use the staff an awfull lot, but when we did, they were helpfull. All in all a great hotel in Amsterdam, if you are ok with staying a bit outside the touristic area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel shame about the staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner went to Amsterdam for 5 days, we stayed in the Easyjet Hotel for the first 4 nights and thought we would treat ourselves to a luxury stay for the last night. Although Hotel Arena is further out form the city (approx 2miles) the building, decor and furnishings are excellent. However the staff that we had the misfortune of encountering were unwelcoming and unhelpful and this really spoilt the stay for us. We had planned to spend our last evening in the Hotel eating at the restaurant and relaxing in the bar. After one drink in the bar we decided to travel back to the city, the atmosphere was cold and the bar staff were as welcoming and friendly as the staff at the front desk. Avoid this hotel if you like to be greeted with a smile and treated like a guest.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The location is good and not that far from the city centre. Would probably take 30-40min walk, but trams are quite good and run every 7-10mins. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was excellent as it had the balcony work area. Brakfast was very rich and delicious allthough it was expensive. The hotel needs a freshening up. Slow internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and amazing building”
Reviews.Author: April F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Artis and the Tropenmuseum and is near public transport which will take you directly in to the city center. The hotel is in a beautiful building which use to be an orphanhouse. The interior is modern and they do have spacious rooms with high ceilings. Breakfast buffet is good and includes champagne and fresh fruits.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: ozyt
Reviews.Content: A very old hotel but renovated on the inside. Nice and clean but not much privacy in the room if you are using the bathroom just a glass separating not even frosted, found that to be a bit annoying, also was slapped on with some city tax during checkout not sure if that is same all over amsterdam. hotel also has its own club looked pretty good but didn't go as we wanted to go to other places.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel; Just beware of the reservation money they take off you at check in - Make sure you get it back”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the beginning of December for my boyfriend's birthday and I was really impressed with the whole hotel. Paid a little extra and booked a Studio room which looked exactly like the photos on the website. Lovely rooms (not huge) but nice and cosy for a romantic weekend and I loved the contrast of the white and black bathroom. Beds and pillows were really comfy, just what was needed after a long day in the city. The bathroom was huge and had a great walk in shower. Used the hotel bar on the first night as we arrived quite late and to be honest it wasn't too expensive in comparison to the drinks prices that we paid at other bars over the course of the weekend. Location: The hotel isn't central but Amsterdam seems really small and it was so easy to get around the whole city. There is tram stops close to the hotel which take you to just about every location within the city (I think the longest tram ride was to a market just past Jordaan and it took about 15minutes to get to). There is also a great zoo close to the hotel. The only thing I could fault with the hotel is that upon check-in the receptionist asked for a credit card and when I asked what for as the room had been paid in advance,she replied hesitantly that it was to secure the reservation. Once in the room, I had noticed that it stated on the desk that a deposit is taken from your account upon check-in but when the receptionist asked for my credit card she didn't tell me that she would be taking a deposit from my account. So I went straight to the receptionist and asked how much deposit was taken and she said that no money had been taken out, 200 euros had been put on hold incase of mini-bar charges, breakages, etc. On checkout I paid for city tax and mini-bar charges by cash and enquired about the 200euros and was informed that the deposit was cleared and nothing was taken from my account. When checking my bank balance 8 days later, surprise surprise 200 euros was missing from my balance so after emailing the hotel I received a reply informing me that no deposits get kept but then five minutes later received another email apologising as they realised that they had kept my 200 euros and hadn't put it back into my bank account. Kind of do wonder how many people they get away with doing this to and how many people don't actually realise that they have money missing from their account because of this. If this does happen to you, email both reservation and reception as you seem to get a quicker response this way. Despite the deposit fiasco, it doesn't put me off staying at the hotel again as the hotel completely made up for it. It is beautiful and we enjoyed staying in this location as it wasn't right in the middle of it all but it was close enough and easy enough to get to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: theodorekakoliris
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Arena beginning of December with my girlfriend, in search of relaxing holidays. The hotel and staff do give you the feeling, of a pleasant and relaxing stay and are quite friendly. Reception:All of them friendly and experienced. Room service:Slow Restaurant:Never tried it Room:Clean and cozy Price:Satisfying Reservations dept online:Very average,some unanswered e-mails. Quite far from city center, but if you are looking for a good and quite area,this is your pick. Tram passes right in front of hotel. Luggage assistance doesn't exist, which is a negative point. We specifically did not need any, but you cannot be a 4 star hotel without porters. Overall a great vacation settlement.

Reviews.Title: “Soapy beerglass (but that's really the only minus)”
Reviews.Author: RichardBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business in this spacy hotel which very well reflects the Dutch culture and 'ziel' as it is located in a robuste merchant house, so it seems (the Dutch invented modern day trade), restyled very eclectically (the Dutch always had a very open, multicultural society), solidly and with care so that it will last for a long time (they managed to win a sixth or so of their country from the sea over the last centuries), and still without loosing a sense of conviviality (the Dutch 'gezelligheid'). I therefore liked this hotel and recommend it. It has a parking lot next doors (not a luxury in amsterdam). Don't know though how far it is from the city centre. Ah yes... When my friend and I asked a beer in the cosy hotel bar we got a glass that was still soaking in soap... And we had not ordered a Dutch beer (in which case it would not have mattered :-) anyhow we got a fresh glass with a big smile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DutchieVietnam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend end of October, and enjoyed the hotel. Most of the staff was nice, except for the guy that didn't put us on the guestlist of the accompanying club whilst the room info sheet clearly stated that it was complimentary. The room was beautiful but very very small. Internet is for free, just ask the reception for the login code. We didnt have breakfast here, so no opinion on this one.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: eggbird
Reviews.Content: was there two years ago --> awful, had to stay there again in September for my company and it was much better, actually I enjoyed it very much. People were very friendly, breakfast was great and the building itself has been upgraded. The room can be cleaner but was for sure acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: murca
Reviews.Content: First of all a shuttle bus leaves Schipol airport on a regular basis to this hotel which takes the hassle out of finding trams/buses etc. The hotel is located in a quiet residential neighbourhood. Tram lines are a 3 minute walk away which bring you directly to the heart of the city and all the main tourist and entertainment attractions within 15 minutes. Staff on reception were very helpful and professional. Also, you get a free drink upon arrival which is a nice touch. We stayed in a duplex room which had great novelty value. The narrow and steep steps up to the bedroom could be challenging for some. The bedroom area was spacious and airy. The bed was very comfortable and large. Wardrobe space is located downstairs beside the bathroom which had semi see through walls!!! The bathroom was clean and modern... as was the whole room. Room facilities include ironing board, safe, tea and coffe making facilities. The hairdryer in the bathroom though wasn't very powerful. Overall, a good hotel. Located slightly away from the centre but in a nice quiet area, would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “The happy few...”
Reviews.Author: thedutchguy_10
Reviews.Content: We went to stay for one night as were going to see the national ballet.. the staff were very friendly and helpful, dinner was amazing and the barmen were a lot of fun :)). just booked again for ballet in December !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arena - Most beautiful retreat in the Heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Carolyne M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arena as the perfect setting. Neast in the Heart of Amsterdam and just perfectly located (huge park and Canal 3 minutes walk, a charm). At my arrival from Montreal, the lovely and professionnal woman at the Front Reception, says that she received my note that it was my first time in Amsterdam. She offered me an upgrade from a room to the Most Beautiful Studio 100. The light was incredible in this Studio. Huge windows. I was able to open them and enjoy the lovely loundge music from the Terrasse / Restaurant. Hotel Arena is design but very cosy. The Breakfast was superb as well as the Dinner. I felt at Home, It was perfect. Smiles ans happiness from the Staff. Feel Good. I will be back. No doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Original and nice hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Brussels144
Reviews.Content: Not far away from the city centre (very calm neighbourhood - metro station and tram at about 5min by walk), the hotel is in a beautiful building. The decoration is incredible and the rooms are large and clean. I agree with the fact that you get often annoyed by the cleaning staff but they're very polite. Breakfast is copious but quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Modern twists on a classic building”
Reviews.Author: NeilGeneva
Reviews.Content: Really refreshing to find a "design" hotel that really delivers - the old building has been cleverly transformed and is a pleasure to experience. Surroundings and rooms excellent, staff too, and at very competitive prices. As a business traveller I liked free wifi everywhere (you need a code from reception but you can have as many as you need ie one for laptop one for smartphone etc). My room was on the second floor in the top of the building - elevator access - very comfortable bed, air con, huge walk-in shower, very good selection of international TV channels. Perfect. Breakfast buffet very good and slef service for coffee etc. My first visit but i will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Interior to love”
Reviews.Author: Yozsta
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in Hotel Arena for celebrating our anniversary in Amsterdam. As design fanatics we tend to go for those boutique type hotels and they did a stylish job with this old orphanage building. At check in the friendly staff upgraded us to a suite with our own bath tub right under a skylight in a spacious bathroom! It was just the perfect room for our romantic weekend. The only minus was a sewer smell that appeared in our room when returning from night out and back from breakfast. We needed to check out on the following morning, so the hotel did not have a change to fix the situation. We might also suggest removing the TV or giving a choice of TV-less rooms here - are we in minority or does someone actually watch TV in such a room? They offer a good variety for breakfast spiced up with Dutch specialities - and top it off with Prosecco! Tram connections to Museumplein and Concertgebouw work well. Overall interior of the hotel is characterised by stunning staircases and many stories long curtains that create a bit of a theater feel. To sum it up: an interior to love and to love in.

Reviews.Title: “Be pleasantly surprised in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ibnbatuta1
Reviews.Content: If you have earlier bad experiences at hotels in Amsterdam before, then staying at Arena is likely to change. If it is your first visit, then the stay here will leave pleasant memories. It ticks all boxes. The location is serene. It is accessible by tram from the central station, close to Weesperplein metro and not difficult to reach from the airport if you are using a taxi. If your arrangements does not include breakfast, it is priced at 28 Euros, which I think is ridiculous. I did have this breakfast and it did not offer any thing different that most other places offer charging 9 Euros! This perhaps is the only sore point. The in-house restaurant that is open in the evening is okay. It is not great, but if you had no choice but to use it, it wont disappoint you

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Friendly. Relatively Cheap.”
Reviews.Author: cksf
Reviews.Content: I loved almost everything about this place. My room, on the top floor, had architectural elements that hearkened back to the building's original vocation over a hundred years ago. These were perfectly complemented by elegant furniture, a super comfy king sized bed and a bathroom so slick, I wanted to invite people over for a shower. Nice bar. Loud club next door though, so try to get a room on the north side. Even after the exchange rate I paid less than what I usually do in Toronto or Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff,interesting building and room”
Reviews.Author: angela188593
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting old building,tastefully converted,pleasant and helpful staff. We did not have the breakfast as we went to friends,but it looked good. Our room was an interesting conversion with a sort of loft area,which had all the necessary things. Slept well, comfortable bed, watch out fot the step up to room,could be a problem for some people, tiles falling off in the shower room ! but all in all not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very stylish place”
Reviews.Author: Chapati75
Reviews.Content: Great experience in this stylish hotel. The city center is only a 10 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quite area”
Reviews.Author: Raganella78
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights with my boyfriend in this hotel. It was renovated mixing different styles and the lobby and stairs are impressive. It is located in a quiet area near the zoo, a bit far from the center (30-40 mins walking), but there are good tram connections, so this is not a problem and you can even buy the tram access cards from the hotel lobby. By taxi it is about 10-12 euros from downtown. The room was quiet, overlooking a garden, with double glazing. Just a pity that the outsider window was broken and could not be closed properly. Furnishings were nice and modern and the bed was really comfy. The room was clean (just a bit dusty under the bed). The minibar was pretty expensive, but coffee and tea were free. Free wi-fi was available. The negative point of this room was the very modern bathroom, with no storage space at all to leave make up, etc., open shower and really tiny sinks. So after having a shower most of the bathroom was pretty wet. Moreover the bathroom had see-through glass walls, facing the bed... (I would reccomend it only to couples - at least rooms all on the same floor, as ours). The hotel had a pleasant bar-restaurant with an outdoor terrace where we had a good dinner for a fair price. Also breakfast is served here. We had made an advance booking at a very low rate and breakfast was not included and since it was pretty expensive (â‚¬18) we always had breakfast downtown. Pay attention at the check-in because they were trying to charge us some extras that were not ours, but it was just a misunderstanding and in the end it was absolutely no problem. Overall I would reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Gisela S
Reviews.Content: At a first glance the hotel looked gorgeous and sparkly.....in reality, it would have been fine if it was a 3 star hotel, but it really is nowhere close to being a 4 star. The rooms are tiny but most importantly is that they are flithy and don't expect the bed to be made each day or for mugs to be cleared. As a matter of fact there are no mugs and only plastic cups. The bathroom situation is ridiculous in that when you have a shower it wets the whole bathroom and you can't use the bathroom after you have used the shower unless you willing to mop the floors, walls and toilet seat. Overall shocking and would not recommend. The only positive was that the location was beautiful and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beyondmusic
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a magnificent breakfast buffet. Very good reception and service from the people at the reception. We were travelling with a baby and they asked us if we'd prefer a room at the groundfloor. We received a fantastic duplex room. If I have to say something negative; the location is not ideal (close to the Zoo).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...beyond our expectation!!”
Reviews.Author: travelwitsam
Reviews.Content: We(my wife and folks) stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and were totally stunned with the service as the staff were great!! 1) A special mention to Mr. Robert Leon (the manager) who stepped in when we had a bit of a misunderstanding (from our end) but a valid reason nonetheless.he took a call and sorted our issue in a jiffy and that was the start of some excellent service delivered through the hotel.He is a true asset along with his team.Sephira (i hope i got your name correct) at the front desk showed great courtesy. 2) The rooms were truly magnificent with high celeings comfortable beds 2 tv's(not that u watch any!) 3)The bathrooms were contemporary as was the entire room. 4)The bar was great with the staff again looking after you personally! I was with my wife and parents and we all had a great time and will visit and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'd gladly stay there again !”
Reviews.Author: jakkob
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed and we arrived at the hotel near midnight, but the staff at the reception was very nice and helpful. This hotel is absolutely gorgeous from what we could see. We were kind of worried that we'd hear noises from the club at night, but it didn't happen. The breakfast buffet is varied, offering traditional Dutch as well as continental food. (The only downside to our stay was that our door seemed to be paper-thin; each time somebody walked past our room it felt a bit like s/he was going to enter. It's also due to the fact that this particular room (on the top floor) was placed alongside the corridor. Other rooms with other dispositions probably don't suffer from this.) The hotel is a bit far from the center to simply walk there, but as there are tram stations pretty close this is not a problem at all. In particular, line 9 takes you from Amsterdam Centraal to Alexanderplein, 200 meters away from the hotel. We would definitely stay at the Arena again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezza800
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arena Hotel for 3 nights in July. We spent a weekend in Amsterdam with 2 other couples and this hotel worked out really well. The hotel is just out of the city but easy to get in to the city via tram or hire bikes. The rooms are well priced and a good size especially when you compare them to other options closer to the heart of the city. We arrived before the 3pm check-in but they were happy to hold our bags and we just had a drink in the bar as it was a nice sunny day. The reception staff were very helpful and the room was clean and neat. We had a split level room which was cool - a little bit tricky getting up and down the stairs but no real problem. The room is quite modern with a TV on the bedroom level and nice bathroom downstairs. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with good links to the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Angela_L_Tobin
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in Hotel Arena for my birthday. The hotel room was great - very clean and modern. I was a little annoyed when I was woken up at 8.30am by the housekeeping staff hoovering the corridor. I did feel that the room lacked storage space - a drawer to put my make up in would have been useful. The weather was terrible during our stay so we spent more time in it than we usually would during a city break. Thankfully, it was very comfortable. The reception staff were very helpful and polite. I really liked the location of the hotel. It was far enough out of the centre to be quiet at night but close enough to get to all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful receptionists”
Reviews.Author: kn1901
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April, and we loved it. Located about 25 minute walk from Leidseplein and other central attractions. We rented bikes at the hotel, so the distance was just really nice for a bike ride. The weather this easter was very good, so that made it great for outdoor bike rides. There's a trendy nightclub called 'To:night' in the hotel whch we could hear some noise from even though our room was on the other side of the hotel. It didn't really bother us, and I suppose it's mostly during weekends. The receptionists were wonderful, very helpful with all our enquiries, every one of them provided great service for us. Slightly dusty under the bed. The bathroom has see-through glass walls, so don't be shy when staying here! Good for couples. I will definately use this hotel for my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Swailam
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most hotels i liked in europe.The place is away from the famous Dam square,but it is very easy to access their using the tram.You can even buy the tram access cards from the hotel lobby.The staff is more than helpfull at the reception.The nightclub at the hotel is the perfect place for nightlife lovers with different music styles. The room is perfect,clean,good size and we even had a two floors room. I recommend this place very much......

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, modern, boutiquey hotel in an amazing old building.”
Reviews.Author: LFJYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Quiet, but close to city centre with helpful friendly staff, this hotel is big but not impersonal. The building has obviously had a previous life, if not several, but has been creatively and sympathetically refurbished giving it an atmosphere of modern grandeur.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with period features and unusual decor”
Reviews.Author: Couls
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and well worth staying just outside the centre for. Most hotels in the centre seem to be either small with little facilities or old fashioned, grand and expensive. If you like boutique and modern with a sophisticated bar and restaurant then this is for you. It even has an attached club which is quite famous within the city although you dont hear any noise in the bedrooms. Breakfast quite expensive although what you would expect for a 4*. We ate at several relaxing cafÃ©s along the road which has the entrance to the zoo, nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in quiet location and looks good”
Reviews.Author: Natasha010
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great and was very clean, we had a twin duplex room meaning that our bathroom and beds were downstairs and the living area upstairs so we didn't really use that much. Not ideal if travelling with a friend as the glass bathrooms are see-through and lead straight onto the shower. Mini bar prices were insane. We were dissapointed to find on check in we needed a cash deposit or swipe of a card, â‚¬270 needed, but promised no money would be taken, it wasn't but the money was "held" against my account for a week. The staff member wasn't particulary friendly on check in or out. Breakfast is 18â‚¬ and not great. No discount on entry to the hotels nightclub which is also 18â‚¬. We also had the upgraded room problem, we complained to the company we booked through and got a refund. This is a really nice hotel just a few unexpected hidden extras.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean with best crew”
Reviews.Author: traxstar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arena is placed not very close to anything (walking distance) except the zoo. Its only 2 stops by metro to the shopping, china town, red light etc, 3 stops from central station. We came there late and they said it was full-bocked so they sent us a taxi to a 5 star hotel (Hotel Okura), only for a night though. Anyway, free taxi to the 5-star hotel and then the next morning they drove us back with a free taxi. They let us have free breakfast and then later gave us a better room, because of the problem. Last day, we ate breakfast and wanted to pay, but they just let us had that for free too. The staff was very helpful with everything, with very good english. Even when we had this "dont disturb" on the door, they later sent a mail under the door to contact them if we want to had the rooms cleaned or other things. There are 2 computer on the lobby with free internet. Anyway, Hotel Arena is very nice and clean. The shower could have been more powerful, and better soundproof. Its only 200m to the tram that goes to Leidseplein, where the Holland Casino and all the pubs, shopping etc are, takes only 5min by tram. 400m to the metro, that takes you to the shopping area around central station, only 2 stops.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint of heights!”
Reviews.Author: thebear59
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights at this hotel on our first trip to Amsterdam. Unfortunately upon check in on an overseas flight the hotel couldn't accomodate until 3pm check in. Most hotels do have this policy however this was our first encounter of not having a room. When we received our room it was a split level with the bed upstairs. The biggest problem we had during our stay was that the staircase would be illegal here in North America. We had to go up and down the stairs sidestep as it was only 4 inches wide. On two separate occasions my wife and I each misjudged the last step and almost fell. The split level seems to be common in this hotel as I talked to other guests however their bed was on the main level. Our room wasn't that comfortable as their was only one chair for sitting and that was for the work desk. Upon checkout I did express my concern about these steps and was told next time not to request split level. Water temperature in the shower was a challenge . There are numerous hotels in Amsterdam and everything is accessible via tram or walking. The best is to map where you want to be and see how many hotels are within the vicinity and check for reviews. I would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Would have been perfect if they'd included wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: whatkatydid30 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a pleasant bar with an outdoor terrace and very friendly staff. We checked in with ease and got tips on how to get into the city and an offer to book any tours we wanted to take. The decor is really interesting with a contrast between a very Victorian looking building and very modern furniture, bedding etc. I particularly liked the fabric hangings in all the corridoors and the glass doors to bathrooms/cupboards in the room. We had a fab room with a small, separate seating area and a huge and very comfy bed that we didn't really want to get up from in the morning. We also really liked the double shower/sink in the bathroom though they should probably have gone for porcelain on the sink rather than plastic as it is just starting to look a little scruffy. We were impressed with the hotel overall and the location was within walking distance of the city centre (took us no more than 20 mins to reach the area around the red light district with bars, restaurants etc and it was maybe 35 or so to the station so it was really easy to get around. If you fancy a canal boat trip the hop on/hop off tours have stops near the hotel on two routes and it was a pleasant way to get accross from the station. My only gripe was that the Wifi was â‚¬10 a day and was advertised as being available only in communal areas. I'd always expect that you'd get that for free at a hotel this expensive (we paid Â£115/night room only) and was disappointed not to. The hotel did have a couple of computers in the lobby available to guests so was able to indulge my facebook addictions without charge but still knocks them off excellent for me. Overall though a lovely trip and would be happy to recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A chich Amsterdam Htl.”
Reviews.Author: AggieOne
Reviews.Content: A chic Amsterdam hotel, quite close to the shopping and city centre. Modern and fashionable and smart. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “DONT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT CARD DETAILS”
Reviews.Author: Welltraveledgent
Reviews.Content: Beware as they take your credit card details and charge Â£2500 6 months after departure with no authorisation. No explanation. Check in with cash only if you dare.

Reviews.Title: “Superb: Hotel,Staff,Service,Room,Food,Atmosphere,Location:”
Reviews.Author: redders1511
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must, need I say more? no, but I will. We had the utmost pleasure staying at this hotel, from start to finish.Yes the hotel is away from the hustle & bustle of Dam Square & other areas. This is a PLUS not a MINUS.....The friendliness of the staff,superb food,the room was beautiful,the bed enveloped you & the pillows were springy & the bathroom was spotless & very trendy,We will be staying there again.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who loves quality & comfort. Directions: when you get off the train go to the ticket office,you can have up to 96hour pass to use for any tram. You can use that as much as you like to go were you want.The tram for the Hotel Arena is the number 9.You then walk 500yards to the Hotel.You wont be disappointed.........

Reviews.Title: “Much better value for money than hotels in town, super service and quirky rooms.”
Reviews.Author: smotters
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night over Valentines weekend because everywhere in city was full. We were slightly concerned as the price was so low (compared to the central hotels) and the area looked a bit rough, but we were wrong, the hotel is great!. We were extremely pleased to find the hotel to be excellent; the building is very interesting having been recently converted from an orphanage and the service friendly and obliging from everyone we came across. The city centre is a 30 minute walk or 10 minute tram or metro ride away, so location is no real problem. There is ample secure parking nehind a barrier (this bumps the price up a bit). The bedrooms are split level (bedroom upstairs). The toilet/shower in the room are partitioned by smoked glass wall, you need to be very familiar with your room-mate!

Reviews.Title: “Weed This and Weep”
Reviews.Author: Nell2609
Reviews.Content: The Good: Hotel Arena is located on Gravesandestraat in a nice area, away from the hustle and bustle, adjacent to Oosterpark. From the grand lobby to the restaurant, first impressions are favourable. The Hotel is a short walk from most tram routes, so it is accessible. From the moment we arrived, we could not fault the staff. After an early morning flight, we landed at reception some five hours prior to normal check-in time. We were met with a warm welcome and told that our room was ready for us. Throughout our two-night stay, problems were dealt with quickly and staff were friendly and quick to offer advice i.e. best restaurants in which to dine and quickest tram routes across the City et cetera. Free internet access, from either of the two computers available, was a bonus for keeping in touch with family at home and being able to complete airport check-in online. These are based in the main lobby, next to the Reception desk. The Bad: The purpose of the trip was to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We had upgraded from a standard room to a Deluxe Double. Designer bathroom asides, the overall feel was that of a bog-standard Ikea influenced budget with nothing 'deluxe' to remark upon at all. The well-stocked mini-bar went untouched, owing to the inflated costs of the contents i.e. 3 Euros for a tiny bottle of still water. The Ugly: A cold weather snap meant the temprature of -8 was brought down to -17 taking into account the wind chill factor. The Hotel does not seem equipped to deal with such cold temperatures. A small, under window, radiator meant that this was not sufficient to heat the room. With no underfloor heating, using the designer shower felt like walking into a fridge. Hotel corridors, and second floor lobby, were ice cold and outdoor clothing was required if you wanted to go walk about. There was a floor-length mirror behind the door but, with no overhead lighting, it was impossible to use to any great effect. The only other mirror was located in the dimly-lit bathroom, which meant applying make-up was nigh-on impossible (this, I did using my hand-held compact by the window). As there is no plug socket in the bathroom, I had nowhere to straighten my hair (I ended up turning the mirrored lampbase on end, to get a vague idea of how presentable I was). The usual equipment is to hand i.e. tea-making facilities and iron, but the iron was like a toy iron; not enough heat/weight rendered it useless. In summing up I would stay at a Hotel run by the same staff, but not at the same venue. Don't forget the hidden city tax, which is payable on checking out (12.50 Euros for a two-night stay).

Reviews.Title: “awful hotel - total rip off for what it actually is”
Reviews.Author: london_review_30
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights and was a terrible experience. the staff on reception were very rude in general. no porter to take our luggage. went into the room and they are tiny, it's split on two levels and the bathroom is fine but the living room, if you can call it that is the size of a broom cupboard. this room has 1 small wardrobe so you end up having to dump luggage all over the floor. go up the stairs/ladder to the bedroom which is fine apart from the double mattress is covering two single beds so very uncomfortable. heating didn;t work at all in the first night. engineers knocking on our door at 9am to fix the problem. no apology from anyone for the freezing cold room. nobody cares in this hotel. 2nd/3rd night heating worked and got very hot so turned off and still like an oven. emailed the manager and no response the whole place has an Ikea feel to it, very stylish in parts but a little bit cheap. in the rooms you can hear everyone come and go because the walls are very thin. as others have said the website is appealing but not a true reflection of the hotel. complained about a few things to the reception but they don't care. the area is in a good part of town but quite boring. paying for wifi in a 180 euro night hotel? all in all it was a learning experience for me, trust the authentic sounding reviews and stick with traditional hotels rather than style and no substance hotel arena types.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for politicians... but not me.”
Reviews.Author: dcc251
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible and relatively impressive on arrival; it all went downhill from there. Check in was mayhem and the staff on the desk were just about the most arrogant I've ever met. Our room (at the end of a depressively black corridor) was great. Spacious, clean and with a great bathroom. Our friends' suite was also good - despite a safe that didn't work and bulbs that had blown and not been replaced. The bar was horribly overpriced and, again, staffed by arrogant incompetents. The food served there was extortionate in price, with portion size and price at each end of the spectrum. The best was yet to come - at checkout I ended up having to deal with another arrogant jobsworth. She did nothing I asked her to do and ended up phoning 'the financial manager'. When I asked her why she hadn't passed on my request the reply was an arrogant sneer and her asking how I would know that, assuming that I don't speak Dutch. Unfortunately for her . . . I do. You are not a guest at this hotel, you're just cash.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very classy”
Reviews.Author: KerryMay4
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. It was all very classy and clean with great rooms and comfy beds. Staff were very polite and the food to buy was gorgeous. Definately will be going again. Location wise was out of town, which was great for us, only a short tram to Lidlesplain or Dam Sq and a cheap taxi back at night.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, felt like being home”
Reviews.Author: eggbird
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Arena for businesstrip to Amsterdam. Hotel is very laid back place with nicely modern decorated rooms. Not in the heart of Amsterdam and therefor good to sleep well (no noise like last hotel we stayed downtown). We borrowed some bicycles and everything is within 5 minutes biking [was great fun] . The frontoffice staff is very friendly and the breakfast is good. Very good price/quality. Stayed in a Studio and to pay a little bit extra was def worth it. The room was very spacious and clean. will go there again, hope for fun not for business

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: NZHappykiwi
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived very late after a very long train trip from Zurich. Staff were very friendly and check in was over and done with very quickly. The room was very comfortable and the facilities were excellent. It is set in a quiet suburb.Tram stops to the city centre and suburbs are only a short walk away.About 10-15 mins to the city centre and the tram goes right by the Artis Zoo - well worth the visit. A beautiful city with a relaxed atmosphere. Arena proved a good base

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChantalH
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice venue. At the front desk the girls are very friendly. We stayed in Room 128 at a corner, with a very high ceiling. It was a very clean white room. The mattress was a little bit too soft for me, but that's personal. Breakfast was not too bad, but I have had better. You can hop on public transportation within 500 meters so that's also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Night's Sleep EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Looby83
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hotel Arena as it was outside of the city and we were looking for something a little less hectic. What a fantastic choice! Although the hotel is a good half an hour walk outside of the city center the trams run very regularly and are inexpensive and Hotel Arena is definitely worth the walk! Housed in an historic building, the interior of the hotel is super-modern, combining clean, monochrome lines with beautiful original features such as the ridiculously high ceilings (the staircases are particularly beautiful). Our room was on the ground floor and was a split level room, with perhaps the comfiest bed I have ever slept in, on the mezzanine level. Again, the decor of the room was extremely modern and tasteful and very well thought through. The service was a little patchy, but nothing really to complain about. The daytime reception staff are really polite, informative and helpful but you did get the impression that the nighttime staff were a little less interested. The towels and bedding were replaced everyday when the room is cleaned and tea and coffee are provided within the room. There is also a well stocked, if overpriced,. mini-bar All in all it was a delightful stay in possibly the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric old building and stylish interior”
Reviews.Author: ballyglass
Reviews.Content: we really liked this hotel. We've stayed in four Amsterdam over the last few years, each very different from the other and this one was the best. The photos of the public areas don't do it justice. I was slightly apprehensive having read the reviews and the only thing I agreed with was the cleaning might be slightly substandard. We had a room with a mezzanine. The stairs were steep but the bathroom wall wasn't see through as in someone else's review. It was good that parking is available but you need to realise that it's going to be expensive in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fair but overrated”
Reviews.Author: tomBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Clean and spacious room but smell from the bathroom. After showering water everywhere in the bathroom. Restaurant was very noisy and the indication for drinks on the table was outdated. Food is good but expensive. Location is not good if you need to be in the center but the hotel is near to public transport (tram) and you can buy ticket in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad + Good = Average”
Reviews.Author: MCMember
Reviews.Content: Not ideally located, the Arena is a boutique hotel with personality (for instance split-level rooms). Upon arrival, I realised that linen had not been changed from the previous guest. When you claim to be a 4* hotel, this is generally considered as a 'fatal error', even more so as this finding of mine was, let's say, beyond reasonable doubt. Reception were not too apologetic but had the problem resolved promptly. Nice bathroom although I confirm the privacy issue mentioned in another review. I did not experience any of the problems reported by fellow travellers with the credit card authorisation system. However, check out was a bit sloppy and missed that payment for my room had been arranged (despite this having been confirmed at check-in by front desk staff). Nice and lively bar/restaurant with terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lalloRoma
Reviews.Content: Sooo nice hotel in Amsterdam, room with 2 levels, 2 lcd, bedroom upstairs, also trendy the bathroom with a giant shower full glass. Design hotel with a fantastic breakfast. Suggested to all. To come back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel but is let down by...”
Reviews.Author: Jascecosc
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel but is let down by poor service. We had to wait a long time to get served on a few occasions and our room was not cleaned on one of the days we stayed there. The staff are pleasant enough but there just seems like there is poor management of these staff. Looking forward to going somewhere else the next we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in central Amsterdam, quite unique and original”
Reviews.Author: oberone
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Arena is rather unique, but in a very good way. The history of the building explains much about the place, but can only be appreciated after visiting. Its rather unique structure results in a very pleasant environment, with a historical old-world feel in the hotelâ€™s lobbies and corridors combined with ultra-modern rooms. The hotels staff were excellent â€“ friendly, helpful and very welcoming. Breakfast service was quite good and the restaurant was very satisfactory. All in all, a unique place to stay that is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: haakonks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Arena for three nights during a business trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is a little outside the city center, but this is no problem with the good public transport available in Amsterdam. The staff in the hotel was friendly and helpful, and the rooms was very nice and stylish. I had a standard deluxe room, and both the room and bathroom was clean. The only minor complaint I have about the room is that the windows was facing towards the entrance to the hotel, where the hotels night-club is located, which was making some noise. The breakfast at the hotel was good, however the staff working in the restaurant was sometimes slow to take orders. The only negative about my stay was the so called "high-speed internet connection" (wired) costs 15 euro per day, this was a complete rip-off. The connection was very slow, and sometimes it did not work. Wireless internet was only available in the lobby, and costs 12 euro. In 2010 internet access at hotels should be free!!

Reviews.Title: “A design Hotel To Say”
Reviews.Author: Dago72
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a good hotel with nice rooms, great restaurant and the place is well communicated to the center and the main atractions in the city. The only thing is the smell in the bath, to piping...maybe there is a problem with the black waters... It's an expensive hotel and you have to pay for the internet, bad thing, if you go for business...

Reviews.Title: “Hidden nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldFeet
Reviews.Content: I loved everything in this hotel, it's so dramatic, like sleeping in a theatre. The room is modern loft, fancy lamps, a glass bathroom (good for voyeurs), great bed and space. It's a bit hidden though but we rent a bike in the hotel and visited all interesting places. There's a club and a bar in this hotel but we couldn't hear the noise from our room. They also have lockers which was useful cause our flight was later than the check out, so we could kept our suitcases there while we enjoyed a bit more of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but be warned of 150Euro charge”
Reviews.Author: Gougher
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel but not with the best customer service. Upon checking into the hotel i was asked for a card for authorisation, i had no trouble letting them scan my details so they could charge me at a later date for breakfast/mini bar etc. However i wasn't informed that they would block 150Euro from my account. This caused me considerable issues, as the bank in the UK blocked my bank account, and despite being told on check-out that the funds would return immediately, 24 hours later the 150Euro hasn't been returned The hotel itself is gorgeous and the rooms very modern. I'd recommend staying but just be wary of the 150Euro charge. Whilst i was assured this was standard practice across Amstardam i wasn't informed money would be withdrawn from my account, which resulted in me not being able to withdraw any funds and considerably impacted upon my stay in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “to far from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: webbvix
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a long weekend the hotel was very far from the main centre .we got ther late friday so it was dark when we set off for the evening told it was a short walk to the main centre but it wasnt ended up getting a taxi which charged a fortune.i thought i should let people know as i had never been to amsterdam before and thought the hotel would be nearer .our room was really nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “awful service, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: dkjy
Reviews.Content: bad service: rude staff, unhelpful, we arrived and asked if we can book bicycles for the next day. the staff there didnt even check but asked us to rent elsewhere. no free wifi, even if you pay for wifi for 15 euro a day, the signal is only within the hotel lobby, not in your room. we came to know that our flight might be cancelled due to volcano ash cloud and we seek for hotel staff to help to check the website and notify us before we depart to the airport. the staff there refused saying they were too busy, even we could not access to internet on the street, and we were unable to call the airport / airline with our cell phone. once we knew our flight was cancelled and we asked for the price for extension of stay, the hotel raised the price by 70 euro per night. room: we have an attic room where in most area of the room you cannot really stand upright due to headroom problem. we can only sit on bed inside the room. the blanket we had was burnt by cigarette with holes on it. disgusting. location: not close to city centre, have to travel by tram anywhere you go. we asked for info to access to hotel before we depart. we waited for 3 weeks with no email reply.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of pathos, very average service for the high price.”
Reviews.Author: Azzy2010
Reviews.Content: Yes, the buiding is big, the exterior is beautiful, but... rooms are inconvenient - two levels, very steep stairs, no place to hang the closes. In February, it was still cold outside, and in the room too. When I've turned on the heater, all the heat went up, to the "bedroom", and on the "first floor" it was still very cold. So, when you are going out from the shower, the freezing feeling wasn't pleasant at all. The price is above average, but you don't get neither breakfast, nor WiFi. Moreover, even when paid for the Internet connection (3 Eur per hour!) - it was not working. I've ordered the shuttle service to the airport and after 1 hour of waiting it didn't come! When checking out, I was astonished, that I was charged for a tea bag (that was provided in the room, as I supposed, for free, as it is being in the normal hotels over the world) - 6 EUR. So, at least they don't charge for soap and shampoo :) I'll never recommend this hotel to any of my friend or colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chouffe
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly staff. Great rooms. The food in the bar was very nice and we enjoyed it. Maybe breakfast was a bit too much charging us 16.50 euro but very nice. Looking forward to be back in March.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual decor in the room, but comfortable and a good base.”
Reviews.Author: chrissw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a short city break after a business trip to Breda. First of all we were struck by the dark (i.e. black) decor in reception and the public areas of the ground floor, and we wondered what we'd let ourselves in for. Nevertheless we got a very friendly welcome, and because we'd booked a package including parking for our car and 48-hour public transport passes, we were offered free tourist maps and guides, which turned out to be really useful. (I would recommend such a package because the hotel will allow you to leave your car in their car park for the whole of your checkout day, even after checkout time). The story in the room was quite the opposite: after our eyes had acclimatised to the darkness of the public areas, we were presented with the searing whiteness of the room itself: white walls and ceiling, white curtains, white furniture...and a completely black bathroom. The light switches in the bathroom are also black so I spent several minutes searching along the bathroom wall to find the light switch! Be advised that the glass partition separating the bathroom from the bedroom is not frosted glass...and you can see through almost all of it. You have been warned! Also, it might just be my enthusiastic showering which is the problem, but there seemed to be some problem with the water draining away from the shower. You may not have the same problem... Anyway despite the obvious intention for the hotel to distinguish itself by its decoration, the room itself was warm and comfortable, and to have the TV right at the foot of the bed was a nice touch. Some nice toiletries were provided as well. Breakfast was included in our package, and although the breakfast area was often very busy, we found the food plentiful and of really good quality. We didn't use the hotel's own restaurant. As for the hotel's location, it is not really central to the main action in Amsterdam, but there are reliable and frequent trams, the stop being just a short walk away. Our room did suffer a little from traffic noise but not to any great extent. I think this hotel may try deliberately to attract a younger clientele. That was certainly the impression we got during our stay. All in all I would stay there again, now I know what to expect!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: rnaidu
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel with good rooms, good service and a great restaurant. Everything was perfect. Close enough to the city center but yet far enough to be away from the business but easy enough to get to by a quick taxi ride. Amazing chef in the formal dining restaurant for dinner. Get him to cook you a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, lovely service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: J4yda
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Amsterdam and Hotel Arena was without doubt the best hotel I have stayed in. The service I received leading up to my trip was great, I had some initial queiries which I e-mailed through and a lovely gentleman called Robert Leon was very prompt and efficient with each of his responses. On arrival the hotel staff were equally friendly and helpful. We were very impresses with our room - we had a studio with a bath and it was wonderful. The room was spacious, modern and clean, and overlooked the canal which was a lovely touch. One thing I have to stress about the room was the bed, it was literally the most comfortable bed either of us had ever stayed in, so comforable with the biggest, fluffiest duvet and pillows. The hotel location was ideal, out of the hustle and bustle and just a short tram ride to the city centre. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel, great value for money compared to lots of other hotels in Amsterdam (especially if you get a deal on the internet like we did!).

Reviews.Title: “MEDIOCA”
Reviews.Author: jeni128
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK done nice, but found the room very small, the bathroom very unusal and did smell quite bad, and not very private, i am married, but even so no need to be able to see everything that goes on in there from the bed that was right up next to it... hard to move around the room as lack of space... if we wanted to stay in and watch a film dvd through reception it would have cost 12.50 Euro.... thats near on Â£12 for one rental, i know uk is expensive but that beats us hands down. Trams ok and very frequent into centre etc... Noisy in Hotel with people coming and going out of their rooms as this echoed through the whole hotel everythime someone closed thier room door. breakfast pretty good, didnt do dinner as the menu was the same for 3 nights running.. very expensive to drink in hotel as was charged near Â£7.50 for a single vodka and coke, yes just a splsh of coke was 2.50 or there abouts. overall ok, will not be returning to Amsterdam, as if you smoke pot and like old building then ok, but nothing else to do than look at the ladies down the street, and once u have seen one then u have seen them all. very expensive to eat out, shop, drink.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Marina107
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a really good price . It is a lovely hotel, spacious, wonderful breakfast (especially the homemade rolls) and just a quick train ride from the city centre. We also ate at the restaurant in the hotel one evening and then headed to the club in the hotel, both were definitely worth it. I would totally stay there again and recommend to anyone looking to take in the sights and cultures of Amesterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, attractive, but lacking service”
Reviews.Author: investigator312
Reviews.Content: There are plusses and minuses for this hotel. The cleaning and maid service is problematic. They always left some mess. I had broken glass in one corner of the room all 5 days. They never provided new coffee, which was a real problem since I had jetlag, and was waking up early each morning. The first time I noticed, I called to reception, but they said they couldn't bring any up at that hour. The rooms are small, but nicely decorates. On the plus side, the hotel is decorated in a very hip, contemporary fashion. Breakfasts were very good (don't eat dinner there). The staff are generally very accomodating. The hotel is a bit outside most of what you want to see in Amsterdam - could be a plus or minus.

Reviews.Title: “â‚¬150 deposit .. Beware ..”
Reviews.Author: menapian98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights at the end of August. Had a most enjoyable stay and as with all the other reviews here cannot fault the hotel itself. When checking in the receptionist took my card for pre-authorisation and I was told it would not be charged. Standard for any Hotel and obviously I had no issue with this. We had paid for the room in advance so on checking out we just had to pay for 2 breakfasts. However there were other charges on our bill (a bicycle rental) that were not ours. They apologised for the mistake and we went on our merry way. A few weeks later I was checking my credit card statement and I noticed a charge for â‚¬150.00 from Hotel Arena. I immediately emailed a copy of this to the hotel and requested the payment be refunded. I had no response. I rang and spoke to a staff member who told me it was standard pratice to take a deposit in Amsterdam Hotels. I told her I had been clearly advised my card would not be charged. She did not apologise but said she would now release my payment. As of today I still have not received my â‚¬150 back. It has been 23 days since we checked out. Please be wary if you are checking in as I feel that its unacceptable to take â‚¬150 off somebody for a month when a room has been paid for in advance. I wrote to the manager and have received no response. I am bitterly disappointed with my experience of Hotel Arena's customer service.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: marselkuzyakov
Reviews.Content: this hotel is one of the best in Amsterdam, even if not centrally located. the reviews saying that it takes 5 minutes to get to the center are not realistic if you define what the center of amsterdam really is, plan for at least 15 minutes and then some (there are a couple of trams that go to the center, with change at leidseplein or frederiksplein). a walk to the dam will take you about 25 minutes, but dont let it discourage you. arena has great meeting facilities that also include an old chapel that becomes a night club on weekends. apart from the fantastic building, the branding of the hotel is exceptional, expect everything to be called to-'something': tostay, todrink, todine, tomeet, tonight

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good location and nice terras”
Reviews.Author: chriskonstapel
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in a beautifull room 265 (ask for it!). The room was big with a good bed (one of the first good beds in a hotel and we've seen a few) and a tub in the room. Large bathroom with shower was also available. The room was at the end of a hall so very quiet, half a circle with 3 windows in the roof which give you sun when you wake up and sun when you're getting ready for dinner, nice! Room wasn't that clean (I stepped in glass with my bare feet) and the staff at the desk was to busy to notice the wedding dress of my wife (we've also made a note in the reservation that we were just married), missed a chance there to make the stay unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “well organised, every thing was as planned”
Reviews.Author: paulin43
Reviews.Content: get a price for taxi before hand they will rip you off charged 20euro going -10 return hotel got taxi back for us. expect two pay double for everything 5or 6 euro a pint 18/20 euro for a steak but it was good. get the pass for the trams hop on an off all day and use on the late bus when trams have finished carry a map at all times free from hotel was always getting asked for drirections easy once your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish & friendly”
Reviews.Author: tlv1979
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the 'Secret' list on lastminute.com and paid Â£240 (two sharing) for four nights. We had a deluxe double over two floors and loved it! Lovely decor and finish. Location is ok...5 minute tram to the 'squares' and 10 minutes to the central station. If I ever go back to the Dam again, I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - staff are lovely”
Reviews.Author: cg65
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended - ignore the old reviews from before the renovation, our room was fabulous, enormous shower-room and large bedroom. Bed was fantastically comfortable, could have slept for hours. Food was lovely too. It isn't right in the centre but means it's quiet and it's easy and quick to reach anyway so it really doesn't matter at all - Amsterdam is so easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shortsean
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I stayed for 3 nights, and really loved the mezzanine layout of the room, and had a room that overlooked beautiful gardens. The hotel is stylishly decorated, with high quality fixtures. The restaurant/bar is also very good quality, and reasonable value. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't need to be right in the centre of town. A taxi to the centre is about 10 Euro (from memory), but there are trams and the metro nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the Hotel Arena and Enjoy Amsterdam, if you don't, you're already dead.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0859
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5 night stay with Last Minute.Com so got an excellent deal which is why I have given value an excellent rating, but breakfast is a little steep at 14.50 Euros for the summer and 18.50 the rest of the year, but it is a damn fine breakfast. Our room was also fine; a split level room (you can have bed upstairs and sitting room down or vice versa), the stairs were a little steep so not for an older couple but a lovely room nontheless. The bathroom is also unique; it is a dark glass cube which a closet/cupboard makes up a corner of the cube. Great fun when showering as you can watch tv at the same time. I should also mention the bedrrom has a king size bed and the second of two flat screen TV's. You have access to around 20 free channels including BBC1 & BBC2. Alot of the dutch channels also broadcast in english, especially films and the american sitcoms. Our room was at the back of the hotel so we had a view of the river, which was a pleasant surprise. The food at the restaurant is made to order and therefore to a high standard...a lot of locals eat at the Arena which is always a good sign of quality. We found all the hotel staff to be very nice and helpful, in fact we only encountered one miserable dutch person and she worked in a department store in the Leidesplein area. The Hotel Arena is a great hotel, the staircases which I believe are original from the buildings previous reincarnations, are beautiful. The Hotel also has it's own night club, I didn't try it but I understand it is an award winning venue so the hotel. Reading various reviews on this site, people have whinged about moving tables or noisy corridors, this is not the hotel itself, it is other inconsiderate guests, so if you get the opportunity to stay here don't be put off by these inconsiderates as they stay at other hotels too. Amsterdam is an expensive city so if you are on a budget you probably won't be looking to eat at the hotel or at restaurants everyday, so if you come out of the hotel and go right, cross over the road and over the river and turn left, there is a supermarket on the right side where you can buy various cold meats & salads etc and store them in your mini bar fridge. if you continue walking up past the supermarket you will come to the metro, central station is just three stops from here and Dam Square is a 5 minute walk, just follow the crowds. I have been to all the major cities in Europe and I found Amsterdam to be an inspirational city, unlike a lot of cities you may visit in the world, Amsterdammers don't take their city seriously at all, on the whole they respect their city for it's wonderful but unsung history and for that reason they want you to take them as you find them and we found them to be great. Enjoy the Hotel Arena and Enjoy Amsterdam, if you don't, you're already dead.

Reviews.Title: “Other than comfortable bed, nothing much to say.”
Reviews.Author: 99shippo
Reviews.Content: Positive: Comfortable bed. Negative: Noise like moving tables at night, music heard through the wall, water in bathroom didn't drain including the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Dierregi
Reviews.Content: The Arena is located only four metro stops from central station (therefore within easy reach) and close to the centre, but not so close as to have crowds walking around it. We were so lucky as to occupy one of the newly refurbished rooms and I must say that I was pleasantly impressed. Our room had very high ceiling; a very comfortable, clean, soft bed; very nice bathroom with toilet and shower and an upstairs sitting area, furbished with white, low chairs and a desk + two flat TV screens (one in the bedroom and one upstairs). There was also a closet, a safe and an ironing board. Everything is brand new and looks very clean. The bathroom has indeed glass walls, but it is very dark glass and the middle part is not transparent (for those who might have read some other reviews and are worried about privacy). Our room was located away for the disco and we did not hear any noise, even if we slept with the window partially open. However, if you like arctic temperatures (which we don't) the airco works fine. We had no problem with the check-in and in the afternoon we went to the bar. They serve good food and prices are reasonable (maybe breakfast is a bit pricey, but you can really stuff yourself and again, the food quality is good). I was very much impressed and would definitely recommend it, since such a nice hotel at such a relatively low price is hard to find in European capital cities. Might mention that I visits regularly London and Paris and in both cities hotels are crazily expensive, even when they are total dumps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel it should be higher in the list”
Reviews.Author: JeanneTan
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 days with a friend. The room we had was beautiful. Not large but the bed was comfortable and the whole hotel was clean and airy. It's a really amazing looking place. This place has suffered in the past from bad feedback but I think the recent renvations have done the trick. It's not the most central but great for us as we didn't want to be in the thick of things. Having said that we walked everywhere so that should give you as sense of distance from all the central attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stella-Teo
Reviews.Content: I liked a lot the style of our room.It was a loft.Double bed upstairs and tv.Downstairs ok the room was a litle bit small but it was stylish.White furnitaire that maked a contrast with the black "glass" bathrooom.Also it had another tv!!! A small fridge with some drinks and coffee or tea if you liked. The staff was verry kind. The only strange thing was with the internet connection.You can have internet on your tv but the thing is that when you are online you don't have volume on the tv.I wanted to check something with my e-mails and i couldn't hear nothing. the transportaition is ok.3' walk for the tram stop and 7'-10' for the metro stop (weesperplain). I liked this hotel and we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hideaway”
Reviews.Author: moondizzy
